summary: This is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding an upcoming Wall Street Journal article. The email warns that the WSJ plans to report that subpoenas have been issued to Jeffrey Epstein's pilots and will identify one pilot, David Rogers.

persons.name: David Rogers
persons.context: Identified in the email as one of Jeffrey Epstein's pilots who has been subpoenaed by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. The Wall Street Journal plans to report on this.

persons.name: Kellyanne Conway
persons.context: Mentioned in the URL of a Daily Mail article referenced in the email, which appears to be about Jeffrey Epstein's pilot and Kellyanne Conway.

connections.description: David Rogers is identified as a pilot for Jeffrey Epstein, indicating an employment relationship.

events.title: Upcoming WSJ article on Epstein pilot subpoenas
events.description: The Wall Street Journal plans to report that the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York has issued subpoenas to Jeffrey Epstein's pilots, and will identify pilot David Rogers.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was preparing for a Wall Street Journal article about subpoenas issued to Jeffrey Epstein's pilots.
Pilot David Rogers was specifically identified as a subject of the upcoming WSJ report.
The internal email shows the prosecution team was aware of and managing media coverage related to the Epstein investigation in July 2019.
